intro: Corydalis pseudomicrophylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in woodland and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known.
